intro: Sticherus yungensis, commonly known as the Yungens' sticherus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and small, spikelet-based inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, which helps it thrive in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
